subject: Communication
title: Opening Lines That Hook
description: Learn Opening Lines That Hook in one minute.

hook.text: You have about seven seconds before your audience decides whether to listen or mentally check out.

buildup.text: The worst opening? 'Hi, my name is... and today I'm going to talk about...' â€” instantly forgettable.

discovery.text: The best openings create a gap: a surprising fact, a bold question, or a vivid scene.

twist.text: Curiosity is the hook. When listeners sense an unanswered question, they can't disengage.

climax.text: Steve Jobs opened the iPhone launch with: 'Today Apple reinvents the phone.' No preamble, pure hook.

punchline.text: Start with a bang, not a biography.

quiz.question: Why are strong opening lines important?
